title: Urban Green Spaces and Community Wellbeing
description: Investigating the impact of urban green spaces on mental health and community cohesion in post-industrial cities. This comprehensive study examines how access to parks, community gardens, and green corridors affects residents' psychological wellbeing and social connections.
team: Dr. Sarah Johnson, Prof. Michael Chen, Dr. Elena Rodriguez
tags: mental health, urban planning, community development, environmental psychology

title: Digital Literacy in Rural Communities
description: Exploring barriers to digital inclusion and developing community-based solutions for improving digital literacy in rural and remote areas. The project focuses on understanding local contexts and creating sustainable digital education programs.
team: Prof. David Williams, Dr. Rachel Thompson, Dr. James Liu
tags: digital divide, rural development, education, technology access

title: Climate Adaptation Strategies for Coastal Communities
description: Collaborative research with coastal communities to develop locally-appropriate climate adaptation strategies. This participatory research project works directly with residents to understand their experiences and co-create solutions.
team: Dr. Maria Santos, Prof. Andrew Taylor, Dr. Priya Patel
tags: climate change, community resilience, coastal management, participatory research

title: Heritage Language Preservation
description: Working with immigrant communities to document and preserve heritage languages through community-led digital storytelling projects. The research explores how digital technologies can support intergenerational language transmission.
team: Dr. Lisa Chang, Prof. Roberto Martinez, Dr. Amina Hassan
tags: language preservation, digital storytelling, immigrant communities, cultural heritage

title: Food Security and Local Food Systems
description: Examining local food systems and their role in addressing food security challenges in urban and rural contexts. The study includes analysis of food banks, community gardens, and local food distribution networks.
team: Prof. Emma Wilson, Dr. Carlos Mendez, Dr. Hannah Foster
tags: food security, local food systems, community resilience, urban agriculture

title: Youth Civic Engagement in Post-Pandemic Communities
description: Investigating how the COVID-19 pandemic has affected youth civic engagement and exploring innovative approaches to re-engaging young people in community leadership and social action.
team: Dr. Kevin Park, Prof. Sandra Miller, Dr. Fatima Al-Rashid
tags: youth development, civic engagement, community leadership, post-pandemic recovery

title: Housing Affordability and Community Displacement
description: Comprehensive analysis of housing affordability challenges and their impact on community stability. The research examines policy interventions and community-led solutions to prevent displacement.
team: Prof. Catherine Brown, Dr. Miguel Rodriguez, Dr. Jennifer Kim
tags: housing policy, gentrification, community displacement, affordable housing

title: Mental Health Support in Underserved Communities
description: Developing culturally-responsive mental health support programs in partnership with underserved communities. The project focuses on community-based peer support models and reducing barriers to mental health services.
team: Dr. Nicole Davis, Prof. Ahmad Malik, Dr. Grace Thompson
tags: mental health, community health, peer support, health equity
